title: ‘Saudi Arabia’s bitch’? Tulsi Gabbard has some strong words for President Trump
text:
While President Trump is “locked and loaded” and “waiting to hear” from Saudi Arabia about who was behind last weekend’s drone attacks on two of the Kingdom’s oil plants, Democratic presidential hopeful Tulsi Gabbard fired off an attack of her own on Twitter TWTR, +1.12% :

‘Trump awaits instructions from his Saudi masters. Having our country act as Saudi Arabia’s bitch is not “America First.”’

This isn’t the first time Gabbard, who’s running for office on a platform that includes breaking up the U.S./Saudi alliance, has driven this point home before:

Hey @realdonaldtrump: being Saudi Arabia’s bitch is not “America First.” — Tulsi Gabbard (@TulsiGabbard) November 21, 2018

The Hawaiian congresswoman isn’t alone on this, either. Former Obama administration adviser Ben Rhodes echoed her sentiment.

Just the President saying he will do whatever the Saudis want, including potentially going to war on their behalf. https://t.co/TA1osTYr9w — Ben Rhodes (@brhodes) September 15, 2019

So did Beto O’Rourke and Tim Kaine:

As President I will not go to war for Saudi Arabia, nor will I let Saudi Arabia dictate our foreign policy. — Beto O'Rourke (@BetoORourke) September 16, 2019

The US should never go to war to protect Saudi oil. https://t.co/fUcO00Klvl — Tim Kaine (@timkaine) September 16, 2019

As for Iran’s reaction, Foreign Minister Mohammed Javad Zarif accused U.S. Secretary of State Mike Pompeo of “max deceit.”

Meanwhile, the headlines sent oil prices surging double-digits and weighed heavily on markets. At last check the Dow Jones Industrial Average DJIA, +0.13% was down 160 points while crude CL00, -0.52% was up 11% to $61.16 a barrel.
